00047 #ifndef CMD_LN_DEFN_H
00048 #define CMD_LN_DEFN_H
00049 
00050 #include "cmd_ln.h"
00051 #include "fe.h"
00052 
00053 const char helpstr[] =
00054   "Description: \n\
00055 Extract acoustic features form from audio file.\n\
00056 \n\
00057 The main parameters that affect the final output, with typical values, are:\n\
00058 \n\
00059 samprate, typically 8000, 11025, or 16000\n\
00060 lowerf, 130, 200, 130, for the respective sampling rates above\n\
00061 upperf, 3700, 5200, 6800, for the respective sampling rates above\n\
00062 nfilt, 31, 37, 40, for the respective sampling rates above\n\
00063 nfft, 256 or 512\n\
00064 format, raw or nist or mswav\n\
00065 \"";
00066 
00067 const char examplestr[] =
00068   "Example: \n\
00069 This example creates a cepstral file named \"output.mfc\" from an input audio file named \"input.raw\", which is a raw audio file (no header information), which was originally sampled at 16kHz. \n\
00070 \n\
00071 sphinx_fe -i  input.raw \n\
00072         -o   output.mfc \n\
00073         -input_endian little \n\
00074         -samprate  16000 \n\
00075         -lowerf    130 \n\
00076         -upperf    6800 \n\
00077         -nfilt     40 \n\
00078         -nfft      512";
00079

00096     "Argument file (e.g. feat.params from an acoustic model) to read parameters from.  This will override anything set in other command line arguments." },

00100     NULL,
00101     "Single audio input file" },

00106     "Single cepstral output file" },
00107   
00108   { "-c",
00109     ARG_STRING,
00110     NULL,
00111     "Control file for batch processing" },

00114     ARG_INT32,

00219 
00220 /*
00221  * Log record.  Maintained by RCS.
00222  *
00223  * $Log: cmd_ln_defn.h,v $
00224  * Revision 1.7  2006/02/25 00:53:48  egouvea
00225  * Added the flag "-seed". If dither is being used and the seed is less
00226  * than zero, the random number generator is initialized with time(). If
00227  * it is at least zero, it's initialized with the provided seed. This way
00228  * we have the benefit of having dither, and the benefit of being
00229  * repeatable.
00230  *
00231  * This is consistent with what sphinx3 does. Well, almost. The random
00232  * number generator is still what the compiler provides.
00233  *
00234  * Also, moved fe_init_params to fe_interface.c, so one can initialize a
00235  * variable of type param_t with meaningful values.
00236  *
00237  * Revision 1.6  2006/02/17 00:31:34  egouvea
00238  * Removed switch -melwarp. Changed the default for window length to
00239  * 0.025625 from 0.256 (so that a window at 16kHz sampling rate has
00240  * exactly 410 samples). Cleaned up include's. Replaced some E_FATAL()
00241  * with E_WARN() and return.
00242  *
00243  * Revision 1.5  2006/02/16 00:18:26  egouvea
00244  * Implemented flexible warping function. The user can specify at run
00245  * time which of several shapes they want to use. Currently implemented
00246  * are an affine function (y = ax + b), an inverse linear (y = a/x) and a
00247  * piecewise linear (y = ax, up to a frequency F, and then it "breaks" so
00248  * Nyquist frequency matches in both scales.
00249  *
00250  * Added two switches, -warp_type and -warp_params. The first specifies
00251  * the type, which valid values:
00252  *
00253  * -inverse or inverse_linear
00254  * -linear or affine
00255  * -piecewise or piecewise_linear
00256  *
00257  * The inverse_linear is the same as implemented by EHT. The -mel_warp
00258  * switch was kept for compatibility (maybe remove it in the
00259  * future?). The code is compatible with EHT's changes: cepstra created
00260  * from code after his changes should be the same as now. Scripts that
00261  * worked with his changes should work now without changes. Tested a few
00262  * cases, same results.
00263  *
00264  * Revision 1.4  2006/02/14 20:56:54  eht
00265  * Implement an argument -melwarp that changes the standard mel-scale
00266  * equation from:
00267  *      M(f) = 2595 * log10( 1 + f/700 )
00268  * to:
00269  *      M(f,w) = 2595 * log10( 1 + f/(700*w))
00270  *
00271  * So, 1.0 means no warp,  w > 1.0 means linear compression w < 1.0 means
00272  * linear expansion.
00273  *
00274  * Implement argument -nskip and -runlen arguments so that a subset of the
00275  * utterances in the control file can be executed.  Allows a simple
00276  * distribution of wave2feat processing over N processors.
00277  *
00278  * Revision 1.3  2005/05/19 21:21:55  egouvea
00279  * Bug #1176394: example bug
00280  *
00281  * Revision 1.2  2004/11/23 04:14:06  egouvea
00282  * Fixed bug in cmd_ln.c in which a wrong boolean argument led into an
00283  * infinite loop, and fixed the help and example strings, getting rid of
00284  * spaces, so that the appearance is better.
00285  *
00286  * Revision 1.1  2004/09/09 17:59:30  egouvea
00287  * Adding missing files to wave2feat
00288  *
00289  *
00290  *
00291  */
Generated on Sat Dec 3 20:28:37 2011 for SphinxBase by  1.5.7.1
